Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

I would propose a slightly different refactoring:

DoFnReflector = DoFn reflection entry point
DoFnSignature = Description of the DoFn generated by DoFnReflector
(Right now this is represented as an instance of DoFnReflector, so this change is essentially separating the static parts of "do the reflection" from the non-static parts of "represent the information we got")

DoFnInvoker = The interface for invoking a DoFn
DoFnInvokers = A factory for generating a DoFnInvoker from a DoFnSignature
(The byte buddy code moves here)

This seems like a slightly cleaner separation of the distinct phases:
1. DoFnReflector can produce a DoFnSignature which describes the DoFn
2. You can use that to get a DoFnInvoker if you need it
LGTM

@wikier

The error is because `nose-1.3.7-py2.7.egg` folder is created directly under `python` and not under `.egg` that is why RAT is still complaining about nose related files.

I cloned your branch and make this single line change: https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/814/commits/232590ed7cdaddc133796ee86f1084d12e4b368a

It fixes the problem. I also made a temporary PR (#814) to test this with the actual thing Jenkins is running, and the tests passed.

I believe if you apply this change, all tests will pass.

As a note the issues are `get_version_from_pom` and `sync_version` are not called from anywhere. And I will fix the code to call them in my PR.

PR updated based on the proposal sent to dev@beam.incubator.apache.org mailing list

PTAL
R: @lukecwik @dpmills

I don't think this is a good idea since it impacts all hadoop GCS client users including the pipeline author.

**Update**
Turns out the GCS libraries have changed and now are configurable per instance.

When pipeline authors write gcs files in a ParDo, they will have the same OOM issue.
I think in most cases, streaming DataflowRunner pipeline will write small files in parallel, rather than huge files in sequential.
If pipeline authors have to write big files, they can always create their own gcs GoogleCloudStorageWriteChannel.

What's the best way to avoid threading issues with the static options in test?
When deserializing anything in the SDK, require PipelineOptions to be passed in. A runner will know the context of which PipelineOptions it should supply when deserializing DoFn's and so forth. The deserialization code can have a static thread local reference to pipelineoptions which after deserializing the DoFn/Coder/... clears the thread local reference.
Ben says this has his LGTM, so it looks like you have quorum. I'll merge

What would be the preferred way to annotate T for ValueProvider to work around type erasure?
I'm not aware of a set of annotations that already does other then creating our own set. See for how to create a nested java annotations to handle types like KV<KV<String, Integer>, List<Double>>: https://blogs.oracle.com/toddfast/entry/creating_nested_complex_java_annotations

Could also help us with coders if we read the annotation from the type parameter directly in Java 8 as another way to get typing information.
Why does getter/setter validation need to be special cased?

There are three separate things; these should get factored out three ways.
1. Sink
2. Mutations
3. Example deleting.

Probably easiest to review in that order. Not sure we'll want to merge 3 into here vs posting it elsewhere.
R: @rangadi

Thanks for the fixup.
LGTM, merged
R: @tgroh

Thank you!

Re: threading -- To be clear, this is hooking into sdk/util/Serializer.java?  This seems rather heavyweight, given that the expected case is that the worker startup sets the options once.  Perhaps I'm just misunderstanding the suggestion, though?

Re: Annotations -- excellent.  Should I send a separate PR?

Re: setters: I was thinking that it doesn't logically make much sense to call the setters (outside of specific tests), but perhaps that's not a sufficient reason to elide them.  In either case, do you have a suggestion for how to simulate the "serialized options get a new value set at runtime"?
R: @lukecwik

Yes, the suggestion was about hooking into sdk/util/Serializer.java, also PipelineOptions could be scoped smaller. Alternatively we could give PipelineOptions an "id" and use a static map "id" -> PipelineOptions instance and it would be upto workers to populate all of them.

Setters still make sense with static value providers but I could see why setters should not be allowed for this type if all we wanted was runtimevalueproviders. Need to think it through further.

Annotations as a separate PR sounds good since you should be able to add support for something like List<List<Integer>> which will naturally extend to the ValueProvider.
LGTM
R: @dhalperi

@dhalperi sounds good. Sent another PR for Sink, https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/833. 
Will be able to work on the other two once that is merged. Closing this PR.
Thanks, merging.

Minor comments:
when package relocating guava -> when relocating guava

and then LGTM
R: @vikkyrk
Prediction: BigtableWriteIT will break because Dataflow service does not support this feature yet. This is probably okay.
